page.title: 18BETWS DRIFT MINE AMMANFORD
page.content: This mine is located 2 miles from Ammanford, on the border of the South Wales Coalfield. Betws Drift Mine was opened in May, 1978, the first mine to be opened in over a decade on the coalfield. It replaced a number of neighbouring collieries where all the coal was exhausted. The mine taps the last significant reserves of the red vein anthracite coal. The seam is 4'6" to 5' deep at Betws, and there is said to be a 5 million ton reserve. Almost 700 miners are employed; the majority were from the closed Betws and Graig Merthyr mines. The men were trained before hand to handle the modern computers, in-seam ploughs and disc cutters used in the mine. The output/manshift is 15.6 tonnes, on the face and 1983 saleable output was 589 thousand tonnes.
